channel.description: Like a morning show, only interesting. And at night. We're your only dealer of cracks in the news cycle, Fancy Lads and Cats, or the true Trailer Trash. Subscribe, we'll entertain you just the way you like it. You'll undoubtedly be challenged by strong language, adult themes, and a taste for muuuuurder. item.title: EPISODE149 - What's eating you?
item.author: thantos@gmail.com
item.description: It's not every week that the world conspires to make the show for us, but between loyal viewers sending in their news spotting and our own endless scouring the depths of the news well, this week is going to be MASSIVE. Everywhere from Florida to Sweden, sweetmeats to bath salts. If it's the end of the world, then we know it and I feel fine. The best news in the world followed by Trailer Trash, tonight, worldwide. Come, dig in!

item.title: EPISODE148 - Zombies Leathered Up and Face Down
item.author: thantos@gmail.com
item.description: You know what I never seem to get enough of? Cannibalism. No, I'm not kidding. I'm not saying tonight is all about cannibalism, I'm just saying it's not illegal in Japan is what I'm saying. Also, fetal corpses, and putting genitals in your mouth. Also, the most addictive video game design known to man. Plus, Trailer Trash, which everyone on EARTH is compelled by. Tell your friends!

item.title: EPISODE147 - We're Tenacious, We Like Fruit, and The Bee Hives Are Empty!
item.author: thantos@gmail.com
item.description: There is crazy here. I mean, tonnes of crazy. Endless fields. Tonight's news involves getting the Hell out of the US, we're Seeing To something that I can suck on all night long, The D is back pounding in our ears with their new album, I've seen a new Person of Interest, and there is the best damn entertainment edge you'll ever find, Trailer Trash.

item.title: EPISODE146 -Set Fire to Your Babies, Put Up Your Flukes
item.author: thantos@gmail.com
item.description: Are you ready to rumble? Yeah, you know how this plays out. We've got the best bits of irreverent news updates ready for you, as soon as you come through the door. You want more cannibalism? We've got more cannibalism! You want more Trailer Trash? We've got more Trailer Trash! You want more of the Bee and the Big Leneski rubbing their junk on the mic together? We might have that, too, but only if you promise to write slashfic after.

item.title: EPISODE145 - I'm Totally Clair on the Issue
item.author: thantos@gmail.com
item.description: You know those wild and crazy nights that happen, where you're fascinated by man's inhumanity to man, where the curtains fall and you wonder how in the Hell any of what you just saw came to pass? Yeah, just like that. Decapitation, hanging, free meth from the CIA, we bring you the most important techniques for modern life available! That includes tonight's Trailer Trash, with bits from The Dark Knight, The Devil's Carnival, Simon Pegg, high-speed fists, and, if we can get to it, time travel. Yeeeeeah, boy.

item.title: EPISODE144 - The Wars of Guilder, And Killing Your Wife
item.author: thantos@gmail.com
item.description: Down here in the Pit of Despaaaaaaaair, there's been a really slow news day. News week. Whatev. But there are things afoot in the world, and by the world, I mean Kryta. Guild Wars 2's first beta weekend eats the Squid's mind alive, as does tonight's Trailer Trash and whatever other insanity falls slap into our laps. BSU, cutting edge. Possibly serrated.

item.title: EPISODE143 - Rollin' Dem Headz
item.author: thantos@gmail.com
item.description: Tonight we're blazin' through the new hotness, and that hotness appears to be cannibalism. I know, I know, your mouth is watering even now, but have no doubt we'll feed you good on a movie review (The Raid: Redemption) and all the Trailer Trash you can cram down your gullet as well. That plus the usual band of out of control crazies at the end of a long, long day. Settle down with us. We'll work out the kinks.

item.title: EPISODE142 - Fistful of Geegaws
item.author: thantos@gmail.com
item.description: Change your gears, grind your box, and look for a really good massager tonight. We've got violations of your freedom of speech (and not even for fun!), extraterrestrials, Big Bangs, Killings, and a solid half hour of Trailer Trash for the best, biggest, brightest, shiniest death murder kill kill kill gut slash ... Er, sorry, my mind wandered.

item.title: EPISODE141 - Killin' It
item.author: thantos@gmail.com
item.description: In a true show of solidarity with our bretheren in other worlds, tonight has a wild assortment of the twisted and the referential. We've got the death cults of Northern Mexico, at least one part of airport security working as designed but they still couldn't keep the motherhumpin' snakes off the motherlovin' plane, and the opportunity to buy something from the Hunger Games for only a little over a million dollars! All that and Trailer Trash where things just keep getting deeper and deeper in the race to the bottom of the pile! Bring a friend, tonight, you'll need the moral support, I promise.

item.title: EPISODE140 - Flashing All the Blade We Got
item.author: thantos@gmail.com
item.description: I've got a secret for you folks. It's been a crappy news week for parodists. But there has been a HUGE amount of movie releases and trailers, so all is not lost! What I do have is neo-Nazis in Austria, getting groped in the airport, a spoiler-free review of The Hunger Games, and then metric shed-tonnes of Trailer Trash! Yeah, I'm kind of excited.

item.title: EPISODE139 - Sea of Gladness
item.author: thantos@gmail.com
item.description: Actually, more of a sea of pollen. At this rate I'll have to have the outside of the Satellite of Hate hosed off twice a day; yeesh! If my sinuses can get it together, tonight we'll be talking about all kinds of random crap. Maybe about The Pirate Bay planning to go all non-local supertech. Maybe about Tool being a bunch of tools. Maybe the coolest methods of smuggling evar -- or the worst. BailyCat SHOULD be at the bottom of the tethered beanstalk for the orbital facility tonight, so she'll be joining us IN PERSON for this untoward Hell! All this and the one, the only, the Trailer Trash where we ask the only question that matters, "What th'Hell is wrong with these people?

item.title: EPISODE138 - Dropkick You Right in the Murphies
item.author: thantos@gmail.com
item.description: Congratulamations! You're not (currently) too drunk to read this! That's quite the accomplishment on Saint Patty's day, my friends. Look around. Is there green? If so, you need to clean up the damned vomit and take some seltzer. Dude! Tonight's covered up with the crazy; maybe there'll be inhalable caffeine if the law don't stop us, emo killin', mayhem, terrorism, and douchebags at SXSW. There's also getting crazy prepared for the apocalypse and the ever-lovin' Trailer Trash! Get ready for the action because it won't stop 'til we've painted the whole bathroom a lovely shade of chartreuse.

item.title: EPISODE137 - Rhymes With "Ancient Mariner"
item.author: thantos@gmail.com
item.description: Murder. Straight-up, hardcore, bitch-slappin' murder. Is what you won't hear happening live on tonight's show. As far as I know. What you WILL hear is a lot of stuff about the end of the world, guys turning on their compatriots and dealing drugs for the LULZ, snorting Coke, and maybe even a little bit on my major if I end up going back to college. All that and the Trailer Trash list to end all Trailer Trash lists. Or whatever we can fit into the time we've got. Bring the enemies of your friends to BSU tonight!

item.title: EPISODE136 - Here We Come, Stumblin' Down the Street!
item.author: thantos@gmail.com
item.description: Despite the temptation, this is NOT the all-death show. Sure, there's daydreams, believing and lockers, and TV, Posts, and drudging it out, but there's also ... uh ... mass murder in Syria and ... er ... Violent schoolgirls? Do I even have a single upbeat story in here? Oh, yeah, Putin's penis! All that and the heavy assault of Trailer Trash, this week on BSU!

item.title: EPISODE135 - Harlots in Charlotte!
item.author: thantos@gmail.com
item.description: What do you do if half your crew calls in busy? Easy! You just build a bigger, badder orbiting space broadcast habitat, break out the mind control lasers and directed energy weapons, and start causing leg cramps all over the globe! BSU is brought to you from the brand new Satellite of Hate, code-named UNICRON, in geosynchronous orbit high above Atlanta, GA. Tonight we tell two countries to "get a freakin' room already!", consider Phlebas, wonder at how many people are hanging on to that bandwagon, and feel absolutely overwhelmed at the amount of Trailer Trash! All tonight, at 10pm. Bring your mom. I heard she's hot.

item.title: EPISODE134 - Carbon and Zeerust!
item.author: thantos@gmail.com
item.description:
You probably don't get the title. It's OK, it's pretty underground. You probably never heard of it. (http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Zeerust might help.)
This week we're turning that frown upside down for a full facial covering of news! Those wacky Germans go from the moon to "man on dog" action. There could be ass-explosions this week ... maybe. Cops chasing tail and the dead deeply involved in the political process. And maybe even something serious, waiting in the shadow (wars). Add in a See to It, stir in a bit of movie and trailer review hardcore action, and you've got a show!

item.title: EPISODE133 - You've Got At Least One More Thing Coming!
item.author: thantos@gmail.com
item.description: The Russians are not coming! Putting pointy things in your ass that explode is a bad idea! You need a railing! How does seeing machine-gun fire from your cruise ship strike you? All these things and more on the next episode of ... No, wait, I've done that joke. Trailer Trash this week is imcredibly promising, with zombies, wheelchairs, chainsaws, small furry creatures, trees, xenomorphs, and shirt little schoolgirl cheerleader skirts. Tonight, a solid hour. It's tasty!

item.title: EPISODE132 - Free Meal Burning!
item.author: thantos@gmail.com
item.description: The Judas Priest references just make themselves. But BSU doesn't! Tonight there's more work going in than you can shake sticks at, from being lost in Antarctica and hunted by an alien presence (lake water), to the best criminal screening method ever, to doing it just like the Greeks. Leneski's out at a Con, BailyCat's cookin' with gas, so the Squid and the Bee will be making your dreams come true tonight, like every night. Come for the news, stay for the Trailer Trash, including Nazis, Shakespeare, wrestling monsters, and straight up murder. All that and more more more tonight on BSU!

item.title: EPISODE129 - They're HEEEEERE!
item.author: thantos@gmail.com
item.description: Hit the bell, Jeanine, looks like we've got business! Everyone's favourite mass of writhing, sadistic insanity returns to the air with the Bee, the Big Gripping Leneski, and even the master of horrors himself, the SquidLord punching life right in the balls with a new season, a new year of reviews, deconstruction, cynicism, bitterness, and the best snark you'll find this side of the Ozarks. You too will get slimed -- or at least slimy -- when you listen to BSU. No charm, no subtlety, all action. Just like you always wanted.

item.author: thantos@gmail.com
item.description: The Canadians are coming, the Canadians are coming! Hold on, its been like three straight shows with Canadian bands, "are coming" is kind of implicit. So what's another cool mid-tone rock set from Toronto between friends, anyway? The Theatre Zero, Dings being Kicked, It being Seen To and Sweetness, all at once!

item.title: EPISODE122 - Operation BSU: Ridiculo CON-Carne!
item.author: thantos@gmail.com
item.description: Leneski's out at PAX East and may or may not be calling in from the show floor. The Bee has a real job, real work, and a -- kinda -- real life. He has cats, anyway. Bunny's out in San Francisco scouting a new evil lair facility location; I favour Alcatraz. That means its you and me tonight, baby, making the sweetest sounds since the sound of groaning, twisted geologic plates early this morning! Er, too soon?

item.title: EPISODE119 - Operation BSU: Cuttin' a Baywatch or Somethin'
item.author: thantos@gmail.com
item.description: You like Bovril? How about some quiet rage ignited by international ignorance? Perhaps you just like naked boobies and tentacles. If you're like most of our female audience, maybe you have a secret crush on the Bee. This week, all is revealed! Including the Half-a-Bee's college porn career, the Leneski's pesky scrofula issue, and the SquidLord's agonized reaction to Glee haters. This week, on Soap.

item.title: EPISODE113 - Operation BSU: Rockin' Out With Our Crock Out
item.author: thantos@gmail.com
item.description: Nothing is as much fun as waking up on New Year's Day next to someone you don't know with a Christmas present lodged somewhere inconvenient. This is the show that's the rough equivalent of that experience. We're back from our two-week recovery period and bringing you the best Things That Don't Suck and Kicks in the Ding you'll find outside an Indian buffet. (We prefer Aroma Delight in Lawrenceville, incidentally.)

item.title: Squid's Redoubt: Operation BSU - 028 - The Anti-Justine
item.author: thantos@gmail.com
item.description:
Just because TalkShoe is running a massively huge talkcast opposite us is absolutely NO REASON to not hang out with the crazy crew of BSU to catch all the best news commentary, entertainment updates, and outrageousness you've come to know and love.
This week we throw caution to the wind, drop all the music, and get down to brass tacks. The communal issue of the moment: Damn you, WGA, for taking away our compelling TV! Or maybe you don't care a bit. Drop in and tell us!
item.itunes:author: The SquidLord
item.itunes:subtitle: Squid's Redoubt: Operation BSU - 028 - The Anti-Justine
item.itunes:summary:
Just because TalkShoe is running a massively huge talkcast opposite us is absolutely NO REASON to not hang out with the crazy crew of BSU to catch all the best news commentary, entertainment updates, and outrageousness you've come to know and love.
This week we throw caution to the wind, drop all the music, and get down to brass tacks. The communal issue of the moment: Damn you, WGA, for taking away our compelling TV! Or maybe you don't care a bit. Drop in and tell us!
item.itunes:keywords: music, radio, rock, geek, games, movies, social networks, rpgs, shock jock, shock
